intro: Galium scioanum var. glabrum, commonly known as smooth wood-rose, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems that are typically hairless or nearly so. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often elliptical in shape, with a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
